Class GetSocial

  • java.lang.Object
    • im.getsocial.sdk.GetSocial

extends java.lang.Object

      • getInstance

        public static GetSocial getInstance(Context applicationContext)
        Initialize if necessary and obtain a reference to the GetSocial singleton.
        Parameters:
        applicationContext - The application context of your game.
        Returns:
        The GetSocial singleton.

      • getInstance

        public static GetSocial getInstance()
        Obtain a reference to the GetSocial singleton.
        Returns:
        The GetSocial singleton.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the singleton has not yet been initialized.

        Adds the Layer to an Activity. NOTE: This method must be called from the UI thread.
        Parameters:

      • authenticateGame

        public void authenticateGame(java.lang.String key)
        The method sets your game authentication data, it must be called right after GetSocial.getInstance(Context applicationContext) before using any other functionality offered by the SDK.
        Parameters:
        key - Your game's key, can be found in the GetSocial developer sandbox or obtained from your dev buddy.

      • authenticateGame

        public void authenticateGame(java.lang.String key,
                    GetSocial.OperationObserver observer)
        The method sets your game authentication data, it must be called right after GetSocial.getInstance(Context applicationContext) before using any other functionality offered by the SDK.
        Parameters:
        key - Your game's key, can be found in the GetSocial developer sandbox or obtained from your dev buddy.
        observer - An observer that will be linked to the authentication request and provides insight into how it is progressing.

      • isGameAuthenticated

        public boolean isGameAuthenticated()

      • setLanguage

        public void setLanguage(java.lang.String languageCode)

        public void save(java.lang.String state)
        Creates a new save state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state data to be saved.

      • getLastSave

        public void getLastSave(GetSocial.OperationObserver observer)
        Gets a single save.
        Parameters:
        observer - An observer that will be linked to this communication and provides insight into how it is progressing.

        public void setOnLayerStateChangeListener(GetSocial.OnLayerStateChangeListener onLayerStateChangeListener)
        Register a callback to be invoked when the layer state changes.
        Parameters:
        onLayerStateChangeListener - The callback.

      • setOnTakeScreenshotListener

        public void setOnTakeScreenshotListener(GetSocial.OnTakeScreenshotListener onTakeScreenshotListener)
        Call this if the default screenshot mechanism does not work for your game.
        Parameters:
        onTakeScreenshotListener - Called when a screenshot should be taken.

      • getOnTakeScreenShotListener

        public GetSocial.OnTakeScreenshotListener getOnTakeScreenShotListener()

      • takeScreenshot

        public void takeScreenshot()
        Take a screenshot and allow the user to post it on the Social Bar.

      • takeScreenshot

        public void takeScreenshot(GetSocial.OnScreenshotTakenListener onScreenShotTakenListener)
        Take a screenshot and receive it in the future through the OnScreenshotTakenListener.
        Parameters:
        onScreenShotTakenListener - Called when the screenshot was taken.

      • postActivity

        public void postActivity(java.lang.String text,
                byte[] image,
                java.lang.String tags,
                GetSocial.OperationObserver operationObserver)
        Post an activity on the activity feed.
        Parameters:
        text - The text of the activity, or null if no text should be shown.
        image - The image of the activity, or null if no image should be shown.
        operationObserver - An observer that will be notified of the operations outcome.

      • registerPlugin

        public void registerPlugin(java.lang.String provider,
                  Plugin plugin)
        Register a new instance of a plugin for a specified provider.
        Parameters:
        provider - id of the provider for the plugin implementation.
        plugin - an instance of a plugin implementation.

      • getSupportedInviteProviders

        public java.lang.String[] getSupportedInviteProviders()
        Returns all supported invite providers.
        Returns:
        Array containing constants of all supported providers

      • inviteFriendsUsingProvider

        public void inviteFriendsUsingProvider(java.lang.String provider,
                              java.lang.String subject,
                              java.lang.String text,
                              Bitmap image)
        Invite friends through a specific invite provider.
        Parameters:
        provider - The provider through which the invite will be sent.
        subject - The subject to be sent with the invite. If it is null the default subject is sent.
        text - The text to be sent with the invite. If it is null the default text is sent.
        image - The image to be sent with the invite. If it is null the default image will be sent.

      • verifyUserIdentity

        public void verifyUserIdentity(java.lang.String provider,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> info,
                      im.getsocial.sdk.plugins.AuthPlugin.VerifyIdentityObserver callback)
        Call this method when the user has authenticated or (re)authenticated with a provider. Typically, this is called during the authentication process by the authentication plugin and when the application (re)authenticates the user directly.
        Parameters:
        provider - id of the provider that the user authenticated with.
        info - a Map with the parameters such as the token. See the specifications of the specific provider what kind of key/value pairs the provider expected.
        callback - called when the user is successfully verified or when the verification failed.

      • clearUserIdentity

        public void clearUserIdentity(java.lang.String provider,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> info,
                     im.getsocial.sdk.plugins.AuthPlugin.ClearIdentityObserver callback)
        Clear the identity of the specified provider.
        Parameters:
        provider - id of the provider that the user authenticated with.
        info - a Map with the parameters such as the token. See the specifications of the specific provider what kind of key/value pairs the provider expected.
        callback: - called when the clear operation completed.

      • setUserIdentityObserver

        public void setUserIdentityObserver(GetSocial.UserIdentityObserver userIdentityObserver)
        Register a callback to be invoked when the user authentication state changes.
        Parameters:
        userIdentityObserver - The callback.

      • getUserIdentity

        public GetSocial.UserIdentityObserver.UserIdentity getUserIdentity()
        Returns the currently authenticated user.
        Returns:
        UserIdentityObserver.UserIdentity instance describing the user or null if the user hasn't logged in or has logged out.

        public void close()
        Close the Social Bar.

      • setInviteFriendsListener

        public void setInviteFriendsListener(GetSocial.InviteFriendsListener inviteFriendsListener)
        Provide an InviteFriendsListener if you would like to receive callbacks related to the user inviting friends.
        Parameters:
        inviteFriendsListener - The listener that will receive callbacks.

      • getInviteFriendsListener

        public GetSocial.InviteFriendsListener getInviteFriendsListener()

      • setOnUserAvatarClickHandler

        public void setOnUserAvatarClickHandler(GetSocial.OnUserAvatarClickHandler onUserAvatarClickHandler)
        Register a handler to override GetSocial's default behaviour while clicking on a user avatar. Any click on an avatar from anywhere in the SDK will call this handler.
        Parameters:
        onUserAvatarClickHandler - The handler that will be called.
